Continuation of the story from Half Life 2. While it is a little short (especially by comparison with HL2), it's still very good. It's also fun replaying to go for achievements (like the one where you have to carry a gnome to the end). I suggest buying this on a sale because of a shortness, but if you're THAT into half life (and for some reason don't have the whole series in your library already...) then go ahead and buy it.

You will not be disappointed.

玩完后，终于知道为啥一群人这么些年哭天喊地要3了，剧情断的地方实在是太恶心了，而且结局过于突然，一点反应时间也没有。看的我一脸懵，偏偏那么超展开后十几年都没有后续，要我我也骂娘。
还有看得出来，制作组很喜欢恐怖游戏和星河战队，从本体到第一章和第二章，都会相应元素。

"Half life 2 episodio 2" inicia desde el vamos como una continuación directa del episodio 1, haciendo que el conjunto entre estos forme algo mucho más grande. Con la notable diferencia de que en esta ocasión estamos en presencia de la misma fórmula, pero renovada, cargada de bastante más contenido, siendo en materia mucho más dinámico y armonioso, a diferencia del desequilibrado ritmo narrativo que poseía su predecesor, lo cual conlleva a que la obra no solo avance argumentalmente a pasos agigantados, sino que también se desprenden de la experiencia muchos momentos memorables; 9,8/10 la obra finaliza a esperas de una conclusión, la cual como bien se sabe, esta jamás vio la luz, no obstante eso no quita el hecho de que a nivel tonal, es naturalmente superior a su predecesor, dejando socavada la incógnita de "¿Qué sucederá a continuación? pregunta para la cual aparentemente, y a ojos valve, todavía no estamos preparados para saber la respuesta...

Half-Life 2: Episode Two - 9.0/10 (I Rate 5/10 as average)

Graphics: 5.0/10
Sound Design: 9.0/10
Soundtrack: 6.0/10
Plot: 9.5/10
Dialogue: 9.8/10
Gameplay: 9.5/10
Setting: 9.0/10

Graphics: 
I can't hold the graphics against this game as it came out in 2004. However, for 2004, these graphics were astounding. A 5/10 is average graphics. 

Sound Design: 
I can astutely tell what is going on around me in each level. It is very clear, with each enemy having a distinct sound, each gun having a distinct sound. It makes it very clear to know which enemy is coming so you can handle it. Sound design doesn't get a perfect score as it's a little weird here and there. 

Soundtrack:
The soundtrack has some bangers but the game mostly relies on the sounds of the world to amplify the experience. 

Plot/Dialogue:
I feel that the plot here is better than the original and is super intriguing.  The characters have logical intentions, with a logical progression as it goes on. The facial animations are also better than some of the games that have come out as of late, and this game didn't use motion capture. The dialogue is top tier and will get a good chuckle from ya. The ending here is a great cliffhanger and I understand now why everyone wants Half-Life 3

Gameplay:
The gameplay is definitely one of the selling points of this game. The gunplay is very diverse, with a wide selection of enemies. It really gets you thinking of how to approach the situation. The level design is also extremely well-done, with the game not holding your hand and relying on environmental clues to get you through the mission. It makes the player feel smart, which is great. The gameplay here also expands on the base game, adding some new mechanics and new level design, whish is excellent. 

Setting:
The color and scenery of the forest was awesome to experience. It really got me immersed in the setting which I enjoyed.

Final Notes:
Episode Two serves as a great end to Half-Life 2 and excellently sets up Half-Life 3. I hope to God they release a Half-Life 3.

Финальный на сегодняшний день к огромнейшему сожалению миллионов фанатов (не думаю что сильно ошибся в порядке числа) эпизод одного из величайших явлений и произведений игровой индустрии. Да, поймут не все, но те, кто уже успел стать не совсем молодым человеком и прошел через всю историю вместе с мной, вряд ли изменять свое мнение на другое. В геймплейном и графическом плане в EP2 абсолютно ничего нового, но разве за это мы любим HL и возносим на пьедестал, не так ли? В меру интересное и не слишком длинное приключение с неожиданным и неоднозначным финалом, оставляющее еще больше вопросов.
Рекомендую. Таблетка ностальгии и надежды в чистом виде.

So I just finished HL2: Episode 2 and holy crap was that a better experience than Episode 1. The fact that it takes place outside of city 17 is honestly a breath of fresh air in my honest opinion. Didn't add that many new mechanics other than the FAR BETTER car sections, better than hl2, and vastly improved and stellar physics. And HOLY CRAP THE ENDING! Imagine having to wait 13 years for a new Half-Life game, especially after this big of a cliffhanger!? I knew who was going to die in the ending of Episode 2 but I WAS NOT EXPECTING IT TO GO DOWN LIKE THAT GOD DAMN. This entire experience was beyond worth it, and I cannot wait to buy myself an Oculus Quest 2 and get right into Half-Life: Alyx! 

9/10: A far more refined experience than HL2: Episode 1, although not quite reaching the high bar set by the original Half-Life 2.

This game saved my life.

I am 42.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hearts::hearts::hearts::hearts::hearts::hearts::hearts: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
hl3

The second Expansion pack continues from Episode 1, but you don’t need to play the first episode. Episode 2 is better made. You have to save Alyx Vance with the help of the vortigaunts. Eli Vance is worried for her. Then, you’re realizing that the Combine is after you because Alyx is carrying something valuable. You’re introduced to Dr. Magnusson, who thinks highly of himself. There are new creatures and Combine units. You will also be driving a car, which is a great addition. Choose medium difficulty, because it’s hard enough, and follow the story. Unfortunately, there wasn’t any Borealis game.

I highly recommend this Expansion pack belonging to Half Life 2.
